content: "Le nozze di Figaro" - Libretto Overview (Condensed to 650 Characters)Act 1: The count, Almaviva, tries to seduce Susanna, the fiancée of his servant, Figaro, in an attempt to reinstate the old aristocratic right of "droit de seigneur." Meanwhile, Figaro and Susanna plot to expose the Count’s intentions.Act 2: The Countess, desperate to rekindle her husband’s affection, joins Susanna in a plan to trick Almaviva. Mistaken identities, secret letters, and humorous disguises ensue.Act 3: The lovers triumph, revealing the Count’s infidelity. The opera ends with Figaro and Susanna’s wedding, symbolizing the victory of love and virtue over aristocratic privilege.
